conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q placed at the midpoint between the two plates of the parallel-plate capacitor.

The electric field E between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor is given by E = Q/(ε₀A) where Q is the charge on each plate, ε₀ is the permittivity of free space, and A is the area of each plate.
The electric field can also be expressed in terms of the capacitance C and the voltage V between the plates: E = V/d.
Since the charge Q is related to the voltage V by Q = CV, substitute V = Q/C into the equation for E to get E = Q/(Cd).
The force F on a point charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Substitute the expression for the electric field E into the force equation to get F = q(Q/(Cd)) = qQ/(Cd).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is Qq/(Cd).
